Package ingameObjects

Class HungryBall

java.lang.Object
ingameObjects.IngameObject
ingameObjects.Character
ingameObjects.HungryBall
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class HungryBall extends Character
represents the player characters (controlled by the players), in the games level
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • name

      public final String name
      the String, which is displayed as the players name in the game GUI.

  • Constructor Details

    • HungryBall

      public HungryBall(int position_x, int position_y, int direction, Level l, String name, Game game, int lives, int delay)
      initializes the position of the Character.
      Parameters:
      position_x - x Position of the Character in the level.
      position_y - y Position of the Character in the level.
      direction - direction the Character is moving in: 0: static, 1: right, 2: up, -1: left, -2: down
      l - level in which the HungryBall is created.
      name - string, which is displayed in the gui window as the name of the player.
      game - the game in which the hungryball object acts as a player character.
      lives - a value for the speed of the animation of the hungryballs.
      delay - time (in ms) between the change of the 2 images.

  • Method Details

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      returns the score / points which the player has earned until now.
      Returns:
      the score / points which the player has earned until now.

    • increaseScore

      public void increaseScore(int amount)
      adds score to the players earned score.
      Parameters:
      amount - the score is to be added to the players score.

    • decreaseLives

      public void decreaseLives()
      removes 1 life from the players lives.

    • getLives

      public int getLives()
      returns the amount of times the hungryball is allowed to get hit by enemies.
      Returns:
      the amount of times the hungryball is allowed to get hit by enemies.

    • setLives

      public void setLives(int lives)
      sets the amount of times the hungryball is allowed to get hit by enemies.
      Parameters:
      lives - the amount of times the hungryball is allowed to get hit by enemies.

    • getLevel

      public Level getLevel()
      returns the level in which the hungryball is placed.
      Returns:
      the level in which the hungryball is placed.

    • eat

      public void eat(Eatable e)
      removes the Eatable from the level and adds points according to the Eatable to the score. If the Eatable is a powerup, adds a timed effect on the Hungryball, so it can eat enemies.
      Parameters:
      e - Eatable, that is to be eaten.

    • setSpriteQuadrantRotation

      public void setSpriteQuadrantRotation(int rotation)
      sets the tilt / rotation of how the sprite is to be displayed. 0 = 0Â°, 1 = 90Â°, -1 = -90Â° ...
      Parameters:
      rotation - the tilt / rotation of how the sprite is to be displayed.

    • setSpriteMirrored

      public void setSpriteMirrored(boolean isSpriteMirrored)
      sets a flag which indicates wether the sprite should be mirrored along the y-axis.
      Parameters:
      isSpriteMirrored - true = sprite should be mirrored along the y-axis, false if not mirrored.

    • setUndefeatable

      public void setUndefeatable(boolean undefeatable)
      sets the players capability to eat enemies. true if he is able to eat enemies, false if not (player looses a life instead).
      Parameters:
      undefeatable - players capability to eat enemies.

    • getUndefeatable

      public boolean getUndefeatable()
      returns true if the player is currently able to eat enemies.
      Returns:
      true if the player is currently able to eat enemies.

    • getSprite

      public String getSprite()
      returns the absolute path to the currently active sprite as a String, depending on if the player is currently undefeatable or not.
      Overrides:
      getSprite in class IngameObject
      Returns:
      the absolute path to the currently active sprite.

    • close

      public void close()
      free the acquired resources.
